description.narrative: The most significant expected project-level outcomes are i) environmental effects, through reduction in energy and water uses; and ii) economywide effects through value addition and job creation. Beyond the Project, IFC anticipates that the investment will facilitate the integration of the Kenyan real-estate market into regional and global financial markets through demonstration effects for REIT and REIT-type vehicles.

The proposed investment is a US$25.0 million A Loan (the IFC Loan) to a Kenyan subsidiary of Grit Real Estate Income Group Limited (the Group, the Guarantor, GREIG), a Mauritius-based listed (London Stock Exchange (LSE), Premium Segment, and Stock Exchange of Mauritius (SEM)) real estate investment company with REIT type characteristics building a diversified portfolio of income generating properties across Africa. GREIG will use the IFC Loan to finance a sale-lease back transaction, which comprises: i) the acquisition of an industrial facility (the Existing Facility) with vacant land in Nairobi, Kenya from its current owner with the immediate lease back of the existing premises to Orbit Products Africa Limited (OPAL); and ii) the refurbishment of the Existing Facility as well as construction of new premises on the vacant land (the Additional Facility), which will be similarly occupied by OPAL on a long term lease upon successful completion (the Project). OPAL is an established regional manufacturer of popular personal care and home care products for multi-national clients in East Africa.
